issue.title: youtube.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment > I'm trying to remove the list parameter in https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qa_CU0mvn6s&list=PLDWe0DeV3D3wtXKUUrSTkpgjEpstVtbF9 with the following filter: ||youtube.com$_,removeparam=\&lists as demonstrated in your example but the url transformation does not occur and the list. I could be doing this wrong but I lifted right from your examples and replaced /^ss\\ with \&lists Username: `@pantera` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/9bmxsvt1uwowwcgw4k0scow0gc0wkwf0821oyiedk4.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v4.4.41 System version: | Windows 10 Browser: | Edge License type: | free AdGuard driver: | TDI Tracking protection options: | Hide your Referrer from third-parties,
Hide your User-Agent DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
EasyPrivacy Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | enabled Userscripts: | disabled Userstyles: | disabled ### Issue configuration [Import](https://reports.adguard.com/settings/import.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com)

issue.title: www.amazon.com
issue.body:
